External Resources ​

Author Discovery Process ​

When you need to find author contact information, follow this systematic approach:

Research Tools ​

Author Identification ​

ResourceURLPurpose
ORCIDorcid.orgUnique author identifiers
Google Scholarscholar.google.comAuthor profiles, publications
ResearchGateresearchgate.netAcademic social network

ResourceURLBest For

ORCID ​

What is ORCID? ​

  • Unique 16-digit identifier for researchers
  • Persistent digital identifier
  • Links authors to their work
  • Free to use

Using ORCID for Permissions ​

  1. Search orcid.org by author name
  2. Find ORCID iD
  3. View linked publications
  4. Access contact information (if public)

Benefits ​

BenefitHow It Helps
DisambiguationDistinguish same-name authors
CurrencyOften updated by authors
LinkingConnect to publications
ContactMay include email

Google Scholar ​

Features for Permissions ​

FeatureUse
Author ProfilesFind publication lists
Citing ArticlesTrack usage
Related WorksFind alternatives
Contact LinksHomepage, email

Search Tips ​

  • Use quotes for exact names
  • Filter by year
  • Check "Cited by" for impact
  • Click author name for profile

PubMed ​

Medical Content Search ​

FeaturePurpose
PMIDUnique article identifier
MeSH TermsSubject classification
Author SearchFind publications
AffiliationInstitution details

Using PubMed ​

  1. Search by title, author, or PMID
  2. Find article details
  3. Note DOI for RightsLink
  4. Check PMC for open access

PubMed Central (PMC) ​

  • Free full-text archive
  • May indicate OA status
  • Check license terms
  • Could qualify for Tier 0

CrossRef ​

DOI Lookup ​

FunctionUse
Metadata SearchFind article details
DOI ResolutionLink to source
Citation DataReference information
Publisher InfoRights holder ID

Using CrossRef ​

  1. Go to crossref.org
  2. Enter DOI
  3. View metadata
  4. Click to access article

SHERPA/RoMEO ​

Publisher Policies ​

InformationPurpose
Self-ArchivingWhat authors can post
Embargo PeriodsWhen OA available
License TermsReuse permissions
Color CodesPolicy categories

Policy Colors ​

ColorMeaning
GreenCan archive pre/post-print
BlueCan archive post-print
YellowCan archive pre-print
WhiteNo archiving allowed

Institution Directories ​

Finding Author Contacts ​

SourceHow to Use
University websitesSearch faculty directory
Department pagesFind staff listings
Research pagesLab/group contacts
Alumni databasesHistorical contacts

Tips ​

  • Check for "People" or "Directory"
  • Try department-specific pages
  • Look for research group pages
  • Check recent publications for current affiliation

Professional Societies ​

Society Permissions ​

Society TypeContact Approach
Medical societiesAMA, specialty societies
Scientific societiesACS, IEEE, etc.
Professional associationsIndustry groups

Finding Society Contacts ​

  1. Go to society website
  2. Look for "Permissions" or "Rights"
  3. Check publication pages
  4. Contact membership if needed

Open Access Resources ​

Checking OA Status ​

ResourcePurpose
UnpaywallBrowser extension for OA
DOAJOA journal directory
OpenDOAROA repository directory
COREOA research aggregator

License Verification ​

When content appears OA:

  1. Verify license type (CC-BY, CC-BY-NC, etc.)
  2. Check version (preprint vs. published)
  3. Confirm matches your use case
  4. Document for Tier 0 classification

Best Practices ​

Research Workflow ​

  1. Start with DOI/PMID if available
  2. Cross-reference multiple sources
  3. Verify current affiliation
  4. Document search attempts
  5. Save source links

Documentation ​

For each search:

  • Record databases checked
  • Note date of search
  • Save relevant screenshots
  • Document dead ends too
